title: Why are the boards so sensitive about Sona?
body:
Why is it that whenever you say anything about Sona you immediately get bombarded by downvotes and hateful comments from 50 DJ Sona icons? Why is it that even in the past when Sona had a 53% win rate and 7% pick rate Sona players always still insist "Sona is gutted" and "she has an ***extremely*** small player base"? Why is it that when you point out that Sona is obviously way too strong on this patch, people still insist she isn't?

Let's be honest. Sona is way overtuned on this patch. Pick your poison on which site you use, but Sona is floating around a 57% win rate across all ELOs with around a 20% pick rate now. And no, win rate isn't everything. **However** if you factor in her play rate quadrupled you must also agree that her average skill level has gone down. Having her average skill level go down while her win rate explodes upwards is a pretty good indicator that she is extremely strong right now.

So can we stop pretending she is still fine on this patch? Instead of sticking heads in the sand and insisting nothing is wrong, can we discuss what could be done without destroying her?

No circlejerk is bigger than the anti-Yasuo circlejerk.

Sona players get upset because Riot historically has to keep Sona incredibly weak to balance out how easy she is to play.

If Sona has good numbers, everyone picks her because she's simple with a low skill floor.

So Riot constantly keeps her having BAD numbers, and that's frustrating because Sona fills a stereotypical primary utility niche. She's one of the few basic supports we have left who has lots of buffing power.

Janna is a peeler, Bard and Tahm Kench have extremely weird utility. Leona and Alistar go in. Taric is almost completely defensive. 

Sona and Lulu have primarily buff skills, but Lulu has offensive skills on the same key.

Sona's power is not focused in how she can harm her enemies but how she can strengthen and empower her allies. That's just a fun type of champ to play. If she wasn't so brain dead easy we could actually enjoy her for more than one patch.

The pattern usually goes:

Rework => Bunch of nerfs => Extended amount of time => Repeat

I'm not a Sona main personally, but it's not difficult to see why they would have a sour reputation towards game balance. The majority of the time you see Sona in the patch notes, it's usually either a straight nerf or a buff that also comes with a nerf. And that's for the reason Yetii stated; her numbers can't be good with the kit she has/had.

But at the same time, it's not fun having your main be nerfed constantly. I think back in season 4 or 5 Sona was nerfed in seven or eight consecutive patches. And it's not like the multiple reworks have solved her "How do we give this champion a simple, supporty kit that can be given decent stats at the same time" problem. People like to meme Ryze as the champion that Riot just can't get right, but Sona isn't far behind.

Sona has become one of Riot's favorite punching bags.

>has to keep Sona incredibly weak

The damage from Q for allies isn't seen in the endgame stats as the tagged allies are used as source, we have no damage shielded stat and on a single target(which you usually focus on) it's not that great, but the aoe shield really ads up over the cause of a teamfight.
The teamwide ms boost is massive i used right by the team, yet many players think it's a usless skill...
Alot od sona's power is still hard to apreiciate(and imo that's perfectly fine) and this causes many players to precive her as weaker than she actually is.

I'm not arguing for Sona not to get nerfed, I'm answering the question of "Why do Sona players get so butt-hurt every time Riot touches her?"

No. Sona's base health is lower than every other champion in the game except Anivia. Her base health was nerfed specifically because of her old auras that gave her armor and MR. Then after her rework her base MS was lowered so that her laning pattern of poke and retreat became harder. Specifically she's that much easier to get punished by Thresh, Leona, Blitzcrank and Braum, champions who are supposed to be weak to being poked out.

Sona has no place in the game. She has a high win rate because she scales incredibly well into the late game (and because she's overtuned right now). It's not nearly good enough to make up for how much crap you have to put up with early game because you're glass.

She has no place because of poor champion design. Her laning phase is heavily dependent on simply getting in range, pressing Q, (Powercording if applicable), and retreating. If she has a higher MS she becomes too much of a lane bully for some other supports (specifically squishy non-healers) to handle. But with a lower MS (like now) she performs rather poorly in lane because she is too easy to catch out of place. They could make her tankier, but a tankier Sona will likely lead to new problems and the solution will again be unfavorable.

Her buffed heal may actually be one of the best approaches at this point. Her risk can't be safely lowered but her ability to safely recover can be raised.

She's either single-handedly carries the bot lane by outpoking / outhealing the enemy, due to an item and exp lead. She's too much like Rengar; she becomes absolutely unplayable with some mild nerfs, but give her a buff that's bigger than +5 base AD and she's gonna be wrecking the META. She needs a complete gameplay update because her kit is outdated and like I said before; binary.
